inclusion.criterion: Male and female U.S. Veteran patients 40-85 years old, with Gold Stage II COPD by pulmonary function testing (FEV1/FVC <0.70; performed within 6 months of recruitment.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Eligible subjects must have PH documented on transthoracic echocardiogram within 6 months of baseline visit demonstrating an RV systolic pressure >40mmHg.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: To confirm the presence of PH, a right-heart catheterization will be performed, with subjects randomized to treatment only if catheterization shows a: mPAP >25 mm Hg.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: PH belonging to the following subgroup of the updated Dana Point Clinical Classification: Group 3 (PH associated with lung disease and/or hypoxemia) specifically, Group 3.1 (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease [COPD]) as the major criteria.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients may also have minor clinical features associated with 3.2 (Interstitial disease) (such as mild fibrosis on high resolution chest CT, but total lung capacity>80% predicted) and 3.3 (sleep disordered breathing) (AHI <15 or 20/hour).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: 6-minute walk distance between 50-450 meters at screening visit.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: PH belonging to the following subgroups of the updated Dana Point Clinical Classification: Group 1 Idiopathic heritable drug or toxin-induced Associated Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (APAH) with connective tissue disease congenital heart disease or HIV
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Group 2 left atrial hypertension Group 4 chronic thromboembolic PH or other forms of PH not associated with primary lung disease
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with a history of systemic hypotension in the ambulatory setting (reproducible measurements of systolic blood pressure <89 mmHg) on chart review.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients with moderate or severe hepatic impairment (Child-Pugh B and C)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with severe renal insufficiency (GFR <30 ml/min/1.73 m2)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has multifactorial chronic hypoxemia and dyspnea thought due to diastolic CHF, pulmonary hypertension thought secondary to a chronic ASD and COPD on 5L home oxygen. Cardiology consult recommended a right heart cath for evaluation of response to sildenafil but the patient refused.
